Abstract: This study explores the pivotal role of health care communication in influencing treatment outcomes, focusing on the dynamics of physicianâ€“patient interactions. Utilizing conversation analysis as a methodological framework, the research delves into the nuances of negotiation and decision-making processes within these social interactions. By examining real-life consultations, the study identifies key communication strategies that facilitate effective treatment planning and patient adherence. The findings underscore the importance of mutual understanding and collaborative dialogue in achieving optimal health outcomes. This research contributes to the growing body of literature on health communication by highlighting the critical interplay between conversational practices and treatment efficacy, offering valuable insights for health care professionals aiming to enhance patient care through improved communication techniques.
